sentence.Network_en: He was a deserter. Once he ran from the field of battle.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个逃兵. 有一次,他从战场上逃走了.

sentence.Network_en: They officially and personally regarded De Gaulle as a deserter.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们官方和私人方面皆视戴高乐谨系一流亡者.

sentence.Network_en: A deserter GI was running down a road escaping from two MPs.
sentence.Network_cn: 一个逃跑的大兵在路上跑着躲蔽着两个宪兵.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from desert, on the pattern of French déserteur

entry.def: A deserter is someone who leaves their job in the armed forces without permission.

means.word_mean: 1. a disloyal person who betrays or deserts his cause or religion or political party or friend etc.
2. a person who abandons their duty (as on a military post)

auth_sentence.content: The Syrian defense minister called the pilot who defected a deserter and a traitor.
